metadata.Title: CVE-2023-41105 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in Python 3.11 through 3.11.4. If a path containing '\0' bytes is passed to os.path.normpath(), the path will be truncated unexpectedly at the first '\0' byte. There are plausible cases in which an application would have rejected a filename for security reasons in Python 3.10.x or earlier, but that filename is no longer rejected in Python 3.11.x.

notes.Note: iconstantin> This behavior change was introduced starting in Python 3.11.

criterions.comment: python3.11 package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
